description: Largest prime factor of n, where n runs through composite numbers.
links: Robert Israel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: First composite is 4, largest prime factor is 2, so a(1)=2.
prog: (MAGMA) [ D[ #D]: n in [2..115] | not IsPrime(n) where D is PrimeDivisors(n) ]; // [_Klaus Brockhaus_, Jun 23 2009](PARI) forcomposite(n=1, 1e2, p=factor(n)[omega(n), 1]; print1(p, ", ")) \\ _Felix Fr√∂hlich_, Aug 08 2014
crossrefs: Cf. A002808, A006530, A056608. [From _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Aug 25 2008]
author: Michael Contente (mec1000(AT)aol.com), Mar 08 2000
extensions: More terms from _James A. Sellers_, Mar 09 2000
